messageBody:
I hope I manage not to rekinder the flames on the philosophy of "should I test protected methods".
I just do. For one, I write test cases on the fly as part of my debugging. Here's a wee little trick I came across:

public class A {
         protected x() {
}

public class TextA extends TestCase {
         testx() {
                  AIntruder ai = new AIntruder();
                  ai.testx();
         }

         private static final class AIntruder extends A {
                  public void testx() {
                           x();
                           assertTrue(internalCondition());
                  }
         }
}


Happy coding,
